foreign_keys.foreign_key_comment: Links each salary record to an employee identifier from employees table.
foreign_keys.foreign_key_business_interpretation: This relationship allows analysts to join salary data with employee personal information, enabling a comprehensive view of earnings history per employee.

columns.column_comment: Employee number serving as a link to employee data.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Key column to join with employees table for detailed employee analyses based on salary history.

columns.column_comment: Specific salary amount for the employee during the period.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Used to calculate salary trends, averages, and maximums over time, enabling compensation analysis.

columns.column_comment: Start date of the salary period.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Helps in time-bound analysis, such as salary progression over time or periodic compensation evaluations.

columns.column_comment: End date of the salary period.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Used with from_date for assessing the duration of a particular salary and comparing changes over time.

tables.table_name_comment: Records salary history details for employees, with from/to dates marking the duration of each salary level.
tables.primary_key_comment: Selected emp_no as primary key to facilitate historical tracking of distinct employee salary entries.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Holds crucial salary information and historical changes, providing insights into employee compensation evolution over their tenure.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Enables tracking multiple salary periods for each employee consistently.

foreign_keys.foreign_key_comment: Connects job titles to the employees table by employee number.
foreign_keys.foreign_key_business_interpretation: Allows analysts to link positions held by employees during their tenure, combining personal details with role-specific insights.

columns.column_comment: Employee identifier linking to job titles.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Joinable with the employees table to enrich analyses with job title history per employee.

columns.column_comment: Job title of the employee within the specified period.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Vital for understanding career progression, role transitions, and departmental assignments per employee.

columns.column_comment: Date when the job title was assigned.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Supports chronology tracking and time-specific job title role assessments.

columns.column_comment: Date when the job title ended.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Complements from_date to determine duration of title tenure, supporting trend analysis over time.

tables.table_name_comment: Contains historical records of job titles held by employees over their employment period.
tables.primary_key_comment: Chosen emp_no for linking multiple titles records to respective employees.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Key for analyzing employee career path and role dynamics across organizational history.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Ensures consistent historical tracking of employee titles.

foreign_keys.foreign_key_comment: Associates department assignments with employees by emp_no.
foreign_keys.foreign_key_business_interpretation: Enables linkage of departmental assignments to employee datasets, enriching organizational mapping analyses.

foreign_keys.foreign_key_comment: Links each department assignment to its department in the departments table.
foreign_keys.foreign_key_business_interpretation: Aligns department data to employee assignments, key for organizational structure evaluations.

columns.column_comment: Employee number related to department records.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Allows comprehensive mapping of department assignments per employee by joining with employees and departments tables.

columns.column_comment: Department number linked to employee assignment history.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Enables cross-referencing of departmental memberships and structural analysis by joining with the departments table.

columns.column_comment: The start date of the department assignment.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Facilitates temporal analysis of department tenures.

columns.column_comment: The end date of the department assignment.
columns.column_business_interpretation: With from_date, it allows analysis of duration and frequency of department assignments.

tables.table_name_comment: Tracks department memberships of employees over their career with the organization.
tables.primary_key_comment: Primary key on emp_no allows department tracking across employee careers.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Provides insights into departmental memberships for evaluations of organizational structure and internal mobility.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Provides consistent tracking across department assignments for individual employees.

columns.column_comment: Unique department identifier.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Critical for department-level analysis and cross-referencing with employee assignments.

columns.column_comment: Name of the department.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Enables department name-based reporting and categorization analyses.

tables.table_name_comment: Master table containing information on all organizational departments.
tables.primary_key_comment: Department number uniquely identifies each department record.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: A central resource for compiling and analyzing organizational department data.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Ensures unique identification of each department throughout the database for accurate relational mapping.

columns.column_comment: Unique employee identifier serving as a primary key.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Joinable with other tables to aggregate comprehensive employee analytics across various dimensions (salary, titles, departments).

columns.column_comment: Employee's date of birth.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Enables demographic studies and age-based analysis.

columns.column_comment: Employee first name.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Used for personalized reports and identities in joint analyses.

columns.column_comment: Employee last name.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Critical for identity verification and personalized reporting.

columns.column_comment: Gender of the employee.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Facilitates gender-based insights and diversity analysis with aggregate data.

columns.column_comment: Date when the employee was hired.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Foundation for employment duration and tenure analysis.

tables.table_name_comment: Core table containing comprehensive personal data of employees in the organization.
tables.primary_key_comment: Chosen emp_no as the unique identifier for robust cross-referencing across associated tables.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Serves as the hub for a wide array of employee personal and professional attributes enabling diverse analyses.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Facilitates unique employee tracking across multiple relational records.

foreign_keys.foreign_key_comment: Ties department manager records to employees by emp_no.
foreign_keys.foreign_key_business_interpretation: Allows identification of leadership roles within departments, streamlining managerial path tracing.

foreign_keys.foreign_key_comment: Connects department manager records to specific departments using dept_no.
foreign_keys.foreign_key_business_interpretation: Key to internal organizational management structures and hierarchical mapping.

columns.column_comment: Identifier for managers in various departments.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Primary path to join with employees for managerial role analysis and leadership tenure evaluations.

columns.column_comment: The department number where the employee acted as manager.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Connects to the departments table for department-specific managerial analysis.

columns.column_comment: Start date of managerial role.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Reflects timeline analyses of managerial tenures, adding depth to leadership studies.

columns.column_comment: End date of the managerial role.
columns.column_business_interpretation: Pairs with from_date for managerial duration analysis, informing on management stability.

tables.table_name_comment: Records history of department managers across all organizational departments.
tables.primary_key_comment: Use emp_no to track specific managerial changes and tenure history.
tables.table_name_business_interpretations: Allows for in-depth analysis on departmental leadership transitions and managerial impact evaluations.
tables.primary_key_business_interpretations: Ensures cohesive tracking of managerial history across departments.
